column2: Lone tower standing in middle of nowhere is perfect home for dabbling sorcerer.
A place to sit and studdy the various constellations.
Magic resides in the great garden of magic.
A place of creation, mages create spells and create potions here.
Lands where you can grow food for your province.
Lands where you can grow food for your province.
Take your pick, best whores in the province!
A dwarven stronghold constructed with massive slabs of granite.
Although built low dwarven walls are armed with large tubs of hot oil that is released on besieging armies making dwarven walls some of the finest defenses on The Continent.
Dwarven soldiers are housed in this building until they are called to do their lord's bidding.
The local dwarven blacksmiths gather here to do their work and swiftly distribute the weapons.
A large population of dwarves who have decided to live within the castle walls.
Dwarves drink and brawl here, preparing themselves for the inevitable.
Dwarven lords equip a portion of their force with heavy armor and a dwarven arbalist for ranged combat.
A large population of dwarves live here, their cities are usually built into a mountainside.
Although built low dwarven walls are armed with large tubs of hot oil that is released on besieging armies making dwarven walls some of the finest defenses on The Continent.
Dwarven soldiers are housed here until they are called to do their lord's bidding.
Dwarven guardsmen recruited by the town mayor to uphold order.
Dwarven merchants sell various runes along with freshly hand crafted arms and armor.
Dwarves aren't necessarily famous for their skill with the bow, so instead dwarven soldiers are armoured head to toe and equiped with a heavy arbalist
A large population of dwarves live here, their cities are usually built into a mountainside.
A large population of dwarves who have decided to live within the castle walls.
Although built low dwarven walls are armed with large tubs of hot oil that is released on besieging armies making dwarven walls some of the finest defenses on The Continent.
Dwarves dedicating their lives to protect the religious beliefs of their people.
Dwarven soldiers are housed here until they are called to do their lord's bidding.
Dwarves aren't necessarily famous for their skill with the bow, so instead dwarven soldiers are armoured head to toe and equiped with a heavy arbalist

An elven construct carefully hewn from marble and decorated with intricate markings, usually not built to withstand an army but instead built as a piece of artwork for beauty and harmony comes natural to the elves.
A community of elves surrounding the keep.
The elven youth is taught archery here.
The elven youth is taught how to use a sword here.
A large area outside the keep where elves can breed horses and train their youth to fight on horseback.
A place where elves can sharpen their combat skills.
An elven city constructed from marble and intertwined with great magical gardens.

A clearing in the center of the city where elven merchants trade the finest goods, elves being popular for their glossy silk fabrics, strange elven artifacts, and the finest bow in the world. The zefhar bow.
A large garden embracing the whole city and intertwining it's various quarters.
The elven youth is taught archery here.
The elven youth is taught how to use a sword here.
Local elves are recruited by the mayor to maintain law and order throughout the city.
A temple built by the elves out of white marble, featuring domes, archways, and spires. A truly miraculous feat of engineering.
A community of pious elves residing around the temple itself.
The elven youth is taught archery here.
The elven youth is taught how to use a sword here.
Elves dedicating their lives to protect the religious beliefs of their people.
A prosperous farm built and maintained by the local halflings.
A laboratory common to gnomish settlements, where the local scientists and craftsmen can work together with their advanced technology.

Tor Zireael, the Tower of the Swallow in Elder Speech, is a place about which few people except the Aen Elle are aware. It is a tower containing many magic portals through which one can travel to many different worlds.

The elves themselves destroyed it after their second clash with humans to prevent them from building a city on it's foundations. At its heart is a rose bush covered with beautiful white-lilied flowers. Drops of silver glisten on the petals. They were Aelirenn's flowers, and she was known as the White Rose of Shaerrawedd.
Magical academy for young ladies. Adepts are not permitted to leave the island.

Garstang is the palace on the Isle of Thanedd. The walls emit a strong aura and block magic interference, thanks to Nina Fioravanti. The process of imposing these magical barriers took her nearly a year to perfect.
Also known as the Gulls' Tower, rises above all the other structures on Thanedd Island. On the highest floor of the tower is Benavent's portal, a notoriously unstable portal.

Loxia is the lowest level of Aretuza. It is a huge reception complex for clients and visitors occupying the southeastern foot of the mountain. Most visitors to Thanedd Island see only Loxia and are not permitted access to the other areas.
Ban Ard is famous for the school for young adepts of the magical arts. Many eminent sorcerers of our times were taught there.
